1.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, And loving favor rather than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and the poor meet together: Jehovah is the maker of them all.

3.text: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; But the simple pass on, and suffer for it.

4.text: The reward of humility and the fear of Jehovah Is riches, and honor, and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse: He that keepeth his soul shall be far from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, And even when he is old he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich ruleth over the poor; And the borrower is servant to the lender.

8.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap calamity; And the rod of his wrath shall fail.

9.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; For he giveth of his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out the scoffer, and contention will go out; Yea, strife and ignominy will cease.

11.text: He that loveth pureness of heart, For the grace of his lips the king will be his friend.

12.text: The eyes of Jehovah preserve him that hath knowledge; But he overthroweth the words of the treacherous man.

13.text: The sluggard saith, There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.

14.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit; He that is abhorred of Jehovah shall fall therein.

15.text: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; But the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

16.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his gain, And he that giveth to the rich, shall come only to want.

17.text: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, And apply thy heart unto my knowledge.

18.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee, If they be established together upon thy lips.

19.text: That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.

20.text: Have not I written unto thee excellent things Of counsels and knowledge,

21.text: To make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, That thou mayest carry back words of truth to them that send thee?

22.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor; Neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

23.text: For Jehovah will plead their cause, And despoil of life those that despoil them.

24.text: Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger; And with a wrathful man thou shalt not go:

25.text: Lest thou learn this ways, And get a snare to thy soul.

26.text: Be thou not one of them that strike hands, Or of them that are sureties for debts.

27.text: If thou hast not wherewith to pay, Why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

28.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, Which thy fathers have set.

29.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; He shall not stand before mean men.
